revised_title: Percival Albert Sheppard: A Pioneering Figure in Meteorology
tldr: Percival Albert Sheppard was a leading figure in meteorology, known for his work in atmospheric physics and atmospheric electricity. He made significant contributions to the understanding of weather forecasting and was a key member of the research group at Kew Observatory. Sheppard later became a professor at Imperial College, where he continued his research and teaching until his retirement in 1974.
